meanings.definition: The behavior or attitudes of a conformist or materialistic person.
meanings.sent1: Her babbitries were evident in her obsession with brand names and social status.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't understand why she always followed the latest trends, a true display of babbitries.
meanings.sent3: In the world of babbitries, she was the queen of conformity.
meanings.sent4: His babbitries shone through like a neon sign in a sea of individuality.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the suffocating presence of babbitries, stifling any hint of uniqueness.

meanings.definition: The practice of conforming to conventional, middle-class values.
meanings.sent1: Their babbitries led them to buy a house in the suburbs and drive matching minivans.
meanings.sent2: She felt trapped in a cycle of babbitries, always striving to meet societal expectations.
meanings.sent3: His commitment to babbitries was so strong, he even matched his socks to his neighbor's.
meanings.sent4: The neighborhood was a sea of babbitries, with perfectly manicured lawns and identical picket fences.
meanings.sent5: She tried to break free from the chains of babbitries, seeking a life of adventure and spontaneity instead.
